TemperatureThreshold._help: Defines how fast the fan runs at different temperatures

UpThreshold.help: NBFC will select the next upper threshold as soon as the temperature exceeds *UpThreshold*. in celsius

DownThreshold.help: NBFC will select the next lower threshold as soon as the temperature falls below the *DownThreshold*. in celsius

FanSpeedPercentageOverride._help: Overrides the default algorithm to calculate fan speeds

FanSpeedValue.help: Fan fan speed value which will be written to WriteRegister

TargetOperation.help:
Defines for which operations the speeds should be overridden:

- Read: Value->Percentage
- Write: Percentage->Value
- ReadWrite: both

RegisterWriteConfiguration._help: Allows to write to any EC register

WriteMode.help:
Defines how the value will be written:

- And: register = register bitwise_and value
- Or: register = register bitwise_or value
- Set register = value

WriteOccasion.help:
Defines when the value should be written:

- OnInitialization: writes the value once upon initialization (everytimee the fan control service is enabled or a config is applied)
- OnWriteFanSpeed: writes the value everytimee the fan speed is set.

Register.help: The register which will be manipulated.

Value.help: The Value which will be written

ResetRequired.help: Defines if the register should be reset before the service is shut down.

ResetValue.help: The value which will be written upon reset.

ResetWriteMode.help: See WriteMode. Will only be applied on reset. Valid values: Set/And/Or

Description.help: A short description of what effect the RegisterWriteConfiguration will have

FanConfiguration._help: Defines how NBFC controls a fan

ReadRegister.help: The register from which NBFC reads the fan speed.

WriteRegister.help: The register which NBFC uses to control the fan

MinSpeedValue.help: The value which puts the fan to the lowest possible speed (usually this stops the fan). Must be an integer between 0 and 255 or 0 and 65535 if ReadWriteWords is `true`. Note: MinSpeedValue does not necessarily have to be smaller than MaxSpeedValue

MaxSpeedValue.help: The value which puts the fan to the highest possible fan speed.

MinSpeedValueRead.help: The value which corresponds to the lowest possible fan speed. Will be ignored if IndependentReadMinMaxValues is `false`.

MaxSpeedValueRead.help: The value which  corresponds to the highest possible fan speed. Will be ignored if IndependentReadMinMaxValues is `false`.

IndependentReadMinMaxValues.help: Defines if independent minimum/maximum values should be applied for read operations

ResetRequired.help: Defines if the EC should be reset before the service is shut down.

FanSpeedResetValue.help: Defines the value which will be written to WriteRegister to reset the EC.

NotebookModel.help: The Notebook Model as described in your BIOS. See `sudo dmidecode -s system-product-name`.

Author.help: The Author of the config file. Enter whatever you want.

EcPollInterval.help: Defines how often NBFC polls the EC for changes (in miliseconds).

CriticalTemperature.help: If the temperature exceeds this threshold, NBFC will ignore all Temperature threshold elements and set the fan to 100% speed until the temperature drops below (`CriticalTemperature` - `CriticalTemperatureOffset`)

ReadWriteWords.help: If `true`, NBFC will combine two 8 bit registers to one 16-bit register when reading from or writing to the EC registers.

FanConfigurations.help: Array of at least one FanConfiguration

SelectedConfigId.help: The selected config model. This equals the basename of a notebook model configuration file.

ReadOnly.help: If `true`, fan speeds will not be written to the embedded controller

EmbeddedControllerType.help: Either `ECSysLinux` for using the `ec_sys` kernel module, or `ECLinux` for an alternative implementation using `/dev/port` without depending on kernel modules.

TargetFanSpeeds.help: This holds the fixed speed of the fans. A value of `-1` means the fan should be left in auto mode.
